title: World Archery Câ€™ships 2023: Jyothi Vennam, Aditi Swami, Parneet Kaur win Indiaâ€™s first ever gold
content:
The Indian trio of Jyothi Vennam, Aditi Swami and Parneet Kaur on Friday became the first ever archers from the country to win a gold medal at the Archery World Championships. Playing in the womenâ€™s team compound event, the Indians beat Mexico 235-229 in the final to clinch the gold medal in Berlin.The Indians started the match strong, missing the 10-point mark just once in the opening end to lead Mexico 59-57.They continued in the same vein at the end of the second end, scoring another 59 to Mexicoâ€™s 58, to lead 118-115.As the Indians continued to put up a strong display in the third end as well â€“ scoring yet another 59 â€“ Mexico began to falter, managing only 57. It gave the Indians a comfortable five-point lead going into the final end.The Mexican team of Dafne Quintero, Ana Sofia Hernandez Jeon and Andrea Becerra managed to score another 57 in the final end, leaving Vennam â€“ a four-time silver and two-time bronze medallist at the World Championships â€“ needing to hit just a five to secure gold. She struck nine to give India their first ever gold medal at the Worlds.#archeryThe winning moment... ğŸ¥‡pic.twitter.com/bqTQd4Q97Oâ€” The Field (@thefield_in) August 4, 2023

â€œWeâ€™re very happy weâ€™ve won the first title for India,â€ said Swami to World Archery after the match. â€œWe just focused on our shooting, and we were confident that we would win.â€The trio will be in action on Saturday as well when they compete in the quarter-finals of the womenâ€™s individual compound event.Swami will face the Netherlandsâ€™ Sanne de Laat, while Vennam faces Kaur for a spot in the semi-final.In the menâ€™s individual compound event, Ojas Deotale will compete in the quarter-final against Polandâ€™s Przemyslaw Konecki.
